Source code for pylinac.vmatqa.vmat

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""The VMAT module consists of the class VMAT, which is capable of loading an Open field image and MLC field image and analyzing the
images according to the Jorgensen et al. tests, specifically the dose-rate & gantry-speed (DRGS) and MLC speed (MLCS) tests. The picket
fence tests are analyzed in another module.

Assumptions:
    The physicist has performed the VMAT tests using the Varian DICOM RT plan files based on Jorgensen et al, which control the linac and
    MLCs to deliver a very specific pattern for the DRGS & MLCS tests which are delivered and captured by the EPID.


.. moduleauthor: James Kerns <jkerns100@gmail.com>

Created on Fri Nov 29 11:35:26 2013

"""

# builtins
from __future__ import print_function, division, absolute_import
import os.path as osp

# 3rd party
from numpy import mean, arange, array, zeros, std
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.cm as cm
from matplotlib.patches import Rectangle

# internal
from pylinac.common.common_functions import open_PDF_file
from pylinac.common.image_classes import SingleImageObject


# Common constants
MLCS_seg_strs = ('1.6cm/s', '2.4cm/s', '0.8cm/s', '0.4cm/s')
DRGS_seg_strs = ('105MU/min', '210MU/min', '314MU/min', '417MU/min', '524MU/min', '592MU/min', '600MU/min')


[docs]class VMAT(SingleImageObject):
    """
        The VMAT class analyzes two DICOM images acquired via a linac's EPID and analyzes
        regions of interest based on the paper by Jorgensen et al (http://dx.doi.org/10.1118/1.3552922), specifically,
        the dose-rate gantry speed (DRGS) and MLC speed (MLCS) tests.
        """

    def __init__(self):
        """Class initialization
        If using_pyqa is True, then the other parameters must also be passed in.
        :param axes_open: the matplotlib axes where the open field image will be plotted to.
        :param axes_dmlc: ditto for dmlc field.
        :param results_box: the PyQt4 text box where the text results will be posted to.
        """
        SingleImageObject.__init__(self)
        delattr(self,'image')  # delete the SIO attr 'image'. This is because we'll have two images (see below)
            # and it'd be good not to be confused by the presence of image in the class.
        self.image_open = None # the Open field image
        self.image_dmlc = None # the DMLC field image
        # self._using_pyqa = using_pyqa # whether or not the module is being used in the PyTG142 GUI.
        self._test_type = None
        self._tolerance = 2 # default of 2%
        self._roi_pass = [False]  # list of booleans specifying whether each ROI of the test passed or failed
        self._test_types = ('drgs', 'mlcs')
        self._im_types = ('open', 'dmlc')
        self._passed_analysis = False  # a boolean specifying a final flag about about whether or not the test passed or failed


[docs]    def load_image_UI(self, im_type='open'):
        """Open a Qt UI file browser to load dicom image for given VMAT image.

        :param im_type: string 'open' or 'dmlc'; specifies which file/image is being loaded
        """

        if  im_type == self._im_types[0]:  # open
            caption = "Select Open EPID Image..."
        elif im_type == self._im_types[1]:  # dmlc
            caption = "Select DMLC EPID Image..."
        else:
            raise NameError("im_type input string {s} not valid".format(im_type))

        fs = SingleImageObject.get_imagepath_UI(self, caption=caption)
        if fs:  # if user didn't hit cancel
            self.load_image(fs, im_type=im_type)



[docs]    def load_image(self, filepath, im_type='open'):
        """Load the image directly by the file path (i.e. non-interactively).
        :param filepath: The absolute path to the DICOM image
        :type filepath: str
        :param im_type: Specifies whether the image is the Open ('open') or MLC ('mlc') field.
        :type im_type: str
        """

        img, props = SingleImageObject.load_image(self, filepath, return_it=True)
        if im_type == self._im_types[0]:  # open
            self.image_open = img
        elif im_type == self._im_types[1]:  # dmlc
            self.image_dmlc = img
        else:
            raise NameError("im_type input string {s} not valid".format(im_type))
        self.im_props = props



[docs]    def load_demo_image(self, test_type='drgs'):
        """
        Load the demo DICOM images from demo files folder
        """
        assert test_type in self._test_types, "test_type input string was not valid. Must be 'mlcs', or 'drgs'"

        if test_type == self._test_types[1]:
            im_open_path = osp.join(osp.split(osp.abspath(__file__))[0], "demo files", "MLCSopen-example.dcm")
            im_dmlc_path = osp.join(osp.split(osp.abspath(__file__))[0], 'demo files', 'MLCSmlc-example.dcm')
        else:
            im_open_path = osp.join(osp.split(osp.abspath(__file__))[0], "demo files", "DRopen-example.dcm")
            im_dmlc_path = osp.join(osp.split(osp.abspath(__file__))[0], 'demo files', 'DRmlc-example.dcm')

        self.load_image(im_open_path, im_type='open')
        self.load_image(im_dmlc_path, im_type='dmlc')



[docs]    def run_demo_drgs(self):
        """Run the demo of the module for the Dose Rate & Gantry Speed test."""
        self.load_demo_image('drgs')
        self.set_test('drgs')
        self.set_tolerance(2.0)
        self.analyze()
        print(self.get_string_results())
        self.show_img_results()



[docs]    def run_demo_mlcs(self):
        """Run the demo of the module for the MLC speed test."""
        self.load_demo_image('mlcs')
        self.set_test('mlcs')
        self.set_tolerance(2.0)
        self.analyze()
        print(self.get_string_results())
        self.show_img_results()



[docs]    def set_test(self, test='drgs'):
        """Set the test type for analysis.

        :param test: 'drgs' for Dose Rate & Gantry Speed test or 'mlcs' for MLC Speed test option
        :type test: str
        """
        if test.lower() not in self._test_types:
            raise NameError("setTest input string was not valid. Must be 'mlcs', or 'drgs'")

        self._test_type = test.lower()



[docs]    def set_tolerance(self, tolerance=2.0):
        """Set percentage tolerance for the analysis test. Jorgensen et al. suggests a 3% tolerance but this seems too loose based on XP.

        :param tolerance: Tolerance of will be converted to percentage; e.g. setTolerance(2) sets a 2% test tolerance.
        :type tolerance: float, int
        """
        if type(tolerance) != float or tolerance < 0.1:
            raise ValueError("Tolerance must be a float greater than 0")

        self._tolerance = tolerance / 100.0


    def _get_im_scaling_factors(self):
        """Determine the image scaling factors; initial values were based on 384x512 images @ 150cm SID."""
        # Image size scaling
        y_scale = np.size(self.image_dmlc, 0) / 384.0
        x_scale = np.size(self.image_dmlc, 1) / 512.0
        # center pixel points
        x_im_center = np.size(self.image_dmlc, 1) / 2.0 + 0.5
        y_im_center = np.size(self.image_dmlc, 0) / 2.0 + 0.5
        # SID scaling
        try:
            SID_scale = self.im_props['SID'] / 1500.0
        except:
            SID_scale = 1

        return SID_scale, x_im_center, x_scale, y_im_center, y_scale


[docs]    def analyze(self, test='', tolerance=2):
        """Analyze 2 VMAT images, the open field image and MLC field image, according to 1 of 2 possible tests.
        """
        # error checking that images are loaded. If using in PyTG142, warn user. If using standalone, assert error
        if self.image_open is None or self.image_dmlc is None:
            raise AttributeError("Open or DMLC Image not loaded yet. Use .load_image()")
        if self._test_type is None:
            raise AttributeError("VMAT test type has not yet been specified. Use .set_test()")

        # get the image scaling factors and center pixels
        SID_scale, x_im_center, x_scale, y_im_center, y_scale = self._get_im_scaling_factors()

        # set up ROI points used in both tests
        roi_height = np.round(370 * y_scale * SID_scale)
        roi_ypixels = np.round([y_im_center - roi_height/2.0, y_im_center + roi_height/2.0])

        # set up MLC speed ROI points
        if self._test_type == self._test_types[1]:
            width, roi_no = np.round(42 * x_scale * SID_scale), 4
            x_pixel_offsets = (-107, -49, 9, 68)  # offsets from the central x-pixel which are left-side starting points for the ROIs
            x_pixel_starts = [np.round(x_im_center + (item*x_scale*SID_scale)) for item in x_pixel_offsets] # multiply by scaling factor
            roi_xpixels = [(item, item + width) for item in x_pixel_starts]  # create a list of the left/right

        # set up Dose-Rate Gantry-Speed ROI points
        else:
            width, roi_no = np.round(26 * x_scale * SID_scale), 7
            x_pixel_offsets = np.array((147, 185, 223, 261, 299, 337, 376)) - 256
            x_pixel_starts = [np.round(x_im_center + (item * x_scale*SID_scale)) for item in x_pixel_offsets]  # multiply by scaling factors
            roi_xpixels = [(item, item + width) for item in x_pixel_starts]

        #preallocation/instantiation
        roiratios = zeros((roi_height, width, roi_no))  # 3D array of the ROI ratios
        openroimeans = zeros(roi_no)
        dmlcroimeans = zeros(roi_no)
        meanratios = zeros(roi_no)
        ratiostd = zeros(roi_no)

        # this pulls the ROIs from the Open and DMLC image into new arrays
        # which are analyzed for the mean and standard deviation.
        for roi in arange(roi_no):
            # extract ROI values
            mlcroi = array(self.image_dmlc[roi_ypixels[0]:roi_ypixels[1], roi_xpixels[roi][0]:roi_xpixels[roi][1]], dtype=float)
            openroi = array(self.image_open[roi_ypixels[0]:roi_ypixels[1], roi_xpixels[roi][0]:roi_xpixels[roi][1]], dtype=float)
            # calculate ratio of MLC to Open (what Jorgensen calls Icorr)
            meanratios[roi] = mean(openroi.flatten()) / mean(mlcroi.flatten())
            # calculate standard deviation of ROI ratio
            ratiostd[roi] = std(mlcroi / openroi)

        # an image normalization factor. This accounts for the relative pixel value differences of the two images.
        # Note that this will normalize all the results.
        imagenorm_factor = mean(dmlcroimeans) / mean(openroimeans)

        # attach the ROI ratios and standard deviation of the ratios to self
        self.roi_ratios = meanratios / imagenorm_factor
        self.roi_ratios_std = ratiostd
        # attach other ROI values to self (mostly used by _drawlines())
        self._height = roi_height
        self._width = width
        self._roi_ypixels = roi_ypixels
        self._x_pixel_starts = x_pixel_starts
        self._roi_no = roi_no

        # run a pass/fail test on results
        self._run_passfail()


    def _run_passfail(self):
        """Checks whether the ROI ratios passed the given tolerance.

         This is mostly used in conjunction with PyTG142 to color the ROIs green/red for pass/fail results.
         It's not necessary to run unless draw_lines() is used.
        """
        assert self._tolerance is not None, "VMAT tolerance not yet set"

        # create boolean array the size of the number of ROIs; default to fail until pass
        self._roi_pass = [False] * self._roi_no

        # for each ROI, if ratio is within tolerance, set to True
        for index in arange(self._roi_no):
            if self.roi_ratios[index] < 1 + self._tolerance and self.roi_ratios[index] > 1 - self._tolerance:
                self._roi_pass[index] = True

        # if all ROIs passed, set overall flag to pass
        if all(self._roi_pass):
            self._passed_analysis = True

    def _draw_objects(self, plot, draw=False):
        """
        This method draws lines on the matplotlib widget/figure (pyqa_plot) showing an outline of the ROIs used in
        the calcuation and text of the results

        @type plot: matplotlib.axes.Axes
        """

        # clear images of any existing objects that are on it
        if hasattr(self, 'roi_handles'):
            for handle in self.roi_handles:
                handle.remove()
            for handle in self.text_handles:
                handle.remove()
            if draw:
                plot.draw()

        #plot ROI lines on image
        self.roi_handles = []
        self.text_handles = []
        if self._test_type == self._test_types[0]:  # DRGS
            textstr = DRGS_seg_strs
        else:
            textstr = MLCS_seg_strs

        for index in arange(self._roi_no):
            if self._roi_pass[index]:
                color = 'blue'
            else:
                color = 'red'

            self.roi_handles.append(Rectangle((self._x_pixel_starts[index], self._roi_ypixels[0]),
                                              self._width, self._height, fill=False, edgecolor=color, linewidth=2))
            plot.axes.add_patch(self.roi_handles[index])

            # add text of results
            self.text_handles.append(plot.axes.text(self._x_pixel_starts[index], self._roi_ypixels[0]+25,
                                ('%s: %4.3f +/- %4.3f' % (textstr[index], self.roi_ratios[index], self.roi_ratios_std[index])),
                                rotation=-90, color=color, fontsize=12))
        if draw:
            plot.draw()


[docs]    def show_img_results(self):
        """Create 2 figures showing the open and dynamic images with the ROIs and results drawn on. For standalone module use.
        """
        fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1,2)
        ax1.imshow(self.image_open, cmap=cm.Greys_r)  # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3823752/display-image-as-grayscale-using-matplotlib
        ax2.imshow(self.image_dmlc, cmap=cm.Greys_r)
        ax1.set_title("Open Field Image")
        ax2.set_title("DMLC Field Image")
        self._draw_objects(ax2)
        plt.show()



[docs]    def get_string_results(self):
        """Create a string of the summary of the analysis results."""
        if self._test_type is None:
            raise AttributeError("VMAT test type not yet specified")

        if self._passed_analysis:
            passfail_str = 'PASS'
        else:
            passfail_str = 'FAIL'

        if self._test_type == self._test_types[0]:  # DRGS
            string = ('Dose Rate & Gantry Speed \nTest Results (Tol. +/-%2.1f%%): %s\n105MU/min: %4.3f +/- %4.3f'
                      '\n210MU/min: %4.3f +/- %4.3f \n314MU/min: %4.3f +/- %4.3f'
                      '\n417MU/min: %4.3f +/- %4.3f \n524MU/min: %4.3f +/- %4.3f'
                      '\n592MU/min: %4.3f +/- %4.3f \n600MU/min: %4.3f +/- %4.3f' %
                      (self._tolerance * 100, passfail_str, self.roi_ratios[0], self.roi_ratios_std[0], self.roi_ratios[1],
                       self.roi_ratios_std[1], self.roi_ratios[2], self.roi_ratios_std[2], self.roi_ratios[3],
                       self.roi_ratios_std[3], self.roi_ratios[4], self.roi_ratios_std[4], self.roi_ratios[5],
                       self.roi_ratios_std[5], self.roi_ratios[6], self.roi_ratios_std[6]))
        else:  # MLC Speed
            string = ('MLC Speed \nTest Results (Tol. +/-%2.1f%%): %s\n1.6cm/s: %4.3f +/- %4.3f \n'
                      '2.4cm/s: %4.3f +/- %4.3f \n0.8cm/s: %4.3f +/- %4.3f \n'
                      '0.4cm/s: %4.3f +/- %4.3f' % (self._tolerance * 100, passfail_str, self.roi_ratios[0],
                                                    self.roi_ratios_std[0], self.roi_ratios[1], self.roi_ratios_std[1],
                                                    self.roi_ratios[2],
                                                    self.roi_ratios_std[2], self.roi_ratios[3], self.roi_ratios_std[3]))

        return string




[docs]    def open_Jorgensen_PDF(self):
        """Open the Jorgensen et al paper in PDF"""
        open_PDF_file('Jorgensen, Tolerance levels of EPID-based QA for VMAT.pdf')


#---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# VMAT demo.
#---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

if __name__ == '__main__':
    VMAT().run_demo_drgs()
    # VMAT().run_demo_mlcs()  # uncomment to run MLCS demo
